sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Tom Moore, Owen Moore, Matt Moore, and George Raft
Directed by: Malcolm St. Clair
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmHgXUJMN1TUzR3YhpzxOuBM6YrZ91UVG
üçï GEORGE RAFT'S EARLIEST CAMEOüçï 
From Radio Pictures and RKO Productions comes a big-city tale of three Irish brothers ‚Äî one cop, one crook, and one caught in the crosshairs." 

The three brothers are portrayed by real-life siblings Tom Moore, Owen Moore, and Matt Moore, all well-known screen stars of the silent and early sound periods. Their dynamic performances give the story a sense of authenticity and emotional depth rarely seen in early talkies.

Adding to the film‚Äôs historical value is a brief appearance by George Raft in his earliest surviving film cameo. Long before he became a gangster film icon, Raft made his mark here, making this a must-watch for classic Hollywood fans and collectors alike.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every WEEK on PizzaFLIX.

This RKO release, directed by Malcolm St. Clair, is a hidden gem of Depression-era filmmaking, blending family loyalty, law enforcement, and urban crime into a tight, emotionally driven narrative.
